title: Permanently Banned for 3rd Party Software
body:
Recently my 4 year old League of Legends account was banned because of apparent use of "3rd Party Software". I have spent countless hours and many dollars on this account, I would and have never used any 3rd Party Software that would be against Riot Games policy. I have sent support tickets about this asking about them to be more specific on the ban but was just sent back an automated reply saying I was caught using hacks to gain an unfair competitive advantage. Can a Rioter please look into this further please?
Thanks in advance

I'll be straight with you, usually there are two ways these posts go. 

The first, is that the OP is lying, and is trying to garner sympathy either as a "f you" to Riot or int he hopes that maybe it will somehow convince support to reverse the ban (which doesn't work, because punishments aren't a popularity contest).

The second, is that the OP shared their account. There are a number of reasons, usually it comes down to boosting and the booster used scripts, though sometimes it's a evil sibling or 'friend'.

The fact that Riot gave you the macro answer when you ticketed them doesn't speak well for you, but rather says that upon second look, the ban was still valid. The fact that you say tickets plural speaks even more poorly.

VERY occasionally, there will be a false positive. These usually involve either something like custom skins or account compromise. In these cases, you have to take this matter through player support.

Assuming it was a false positive on something like a custom skin program, you can tell support which program you were using and they will investigate. If it is confirmed to be a false positive they will unban the account.

As for account compromise, normally you'd notice, but if you think you may have been compromised in a given time period you can tell that to support and they may be able to help you. Remember that as far as account compromises are concerned, they don't actually have any obligation to help you, since account security, and by extension all action taken on your account is your responsibility. That said, if they can prove compromise and regain account security then they will likely unban the account.

And Seras the issue is regardless of which way the post goes, it shows one massive thing that riot should do.

For most cases that come to boards, nothing would change. We'd get the same spiel, though we could ask for the correspondence with support/the reform card so they can 'prove' it but those are easily edited.

Those reasons aside though, you know why Riot doesn't give out that info, and you're welcome to disagree, but you have to accept that the policy isn't going to change anytime soon.

It saves them the trouble of having to distinguish between what is harmful and what isn't, and saves the playerbase the trouble of working out if something is allowed or not, and saves those not completely cynical the trouble of working out if the ban was valid or not.
